column4: I'm using 8.10 on a thinkpad t61.  I've just recently pulled updates for my nvidia drivers and xserver, and now my machine will not properly resume from suspend.  I get a black screen.  Is anyone familiar with this issue and perhaps a fix?
which nvidia updates, from where ?
and it won't wake from suspend at all ?
i get a black screen.  It looks like it might be awake though.  Sorry for the poor answer there
no no, thats fine
so it looks like it's actaully awake, but the screen is not alive
yes.  though i haven't tried sshing in from remote
so i can't be sure
that would be a helpful test so we can look at your logs while it's in the unknown state
ok.  I can't do that right now though :-/
understood
do you still have the old kernel installed (I believe there was a kernel update with the nvidia package)
let me check
yes i have many kernels haha.  2.6.27-14-generic is the newest.  I do have 2.6.27-13-generic and more available
I think you have the proposed repo enabled
that could well be the problem, those packages are not stable
ah. let me see
yes i do
is there a way to gracefully downgrade?
ok, I suspect that will cause you pain, disable it, and use the 2.6.27-11 kernel and see how you get on
the next round of updates will tidy up for you
ok thanks
should i disable backports as well?
thanks for your help.
